technical-data.invention-title: Modular construction system and method of construction
Système de construction modulaire et procédé de construction associé

description.p: This invention relates to a modular construction system. In particular, but not exclusively, the invention relates to a construction system, including modules, which are capable of being used in a wide range of applications including buildings and various other structures.
EP 1 219 754 A1 discloses a foldable modular construction system.

US Patent US 5 797 234 (Theodorou) discloses structured modules connected by means of a joint that allows relative movement between walls in three degrees of freedom, via a flexible member, which connects various units one to another.

Examples of building systems which employ different shaped forms are disclosed in: US Patent US 5 249 966 (Hiigli), which describes building blocks for educational purposes; and US Patent US 4 723 382 (Lalvani), which describes building structures based on differing polygonal members.

US Patent Application US 2002/00584546 (Miller) discloses a system of interconnecting construction elements, for use as part of a toy. The system disclosed would not be suitable for use in a construction system for buildings.

UK Patent Application GB-A-2 335 211 (Roberts) describes a hexagonal construction system. Figures 1a and 1b show plan and front elevation views of an element 49. The element is obtained by bending portions of a blank 46 vertically to form walls 50, as shown in perspective view in Figure 2. A plurality of such elements can be assembled together to form a honeycomb structure.

It is an object of the invention to provide improved connecting means between constructional elements of the aforementioned, as well as similar type, which allow greater control and adjustment of a subtending angle defined between adjacent constructional elements. Typically by varying the subtending angle defined between adjacent constructional elements, adjacent sidewalls flex thereby enabling a radius of curvature to be defined.

According to a first aspect of the invention there is provided a modular construction system comprising: a plurality of structural elements of V-shaped or chevron-shaped cross section, adapted to be assembled in a cellular configuration, and a connector, said connector which allows an amount of relative movement between said structural elements in two-rotational degrees of freedom., wherein said movement is provided by a pair of adjacent washers, one washer having a substantially concave surface and the other washer having a substantially convex surface.
Ideally reinforcement ties, bars or bracing units are provided for use in securing diametrically opposite points of a structure formed from said elements.

Connectors may be arranged to urge elements into a curved surface in two or three dimensions, the connectors including predominantly a plurality of identical blocks, said blocks comprising a prism having tapered sides.

Ideally the construction or portion thereof includes blocks that are substantially identical. Alternatively the construction, or a portion thereof, includes blocks whose bases are in the form of a frustum, whose base may be any of the following: triangular, square, rectangular or hexagonal.

According to another aspect of the invention there is provided a method of connecting one item to another using the connector, pair af adjacent washers, and structural elements adapted to be assembled in a cellular configuration. The connector allows an amount of relative movement between said structural elements in two-rotational degrees of freedom.

The second aspect is ideally used to connect V-shaped or chevron-shaped cross sectional modules, however, it will be appreciated that the method of connecting walls of two structural elements one to another, may be used to connect any shaped item or module.

Preferably the connector comprises a bolt-type member, adapted to be inserted into holes in the walls of the elements, having a thread for receiving a nut, and a pair of adjacent washers, one having a substantially concave surface the other having a substantially convex surface. When the convex and concave surfaces of contiguous washers are compressed, they cooperate to allow movement of the joint in two rotational degrees of movement. Spacers may be co-located within the joint. In an alternative arrangement both of the washers may be hemispherical. In a yet further embodiment at least a first and second flat portions adapted to be formed into a prism.

It will be appreciated that, in use, the bolt-type member may be threaded with said washers into appropriate holes in walls of a construction or structure. Similarly a construction may include a wedge between said walls co-located with, and by way of, said bolt-type member.

Ideally holes or apertures are provided in members, so that when members are placed in contact with one another, the holes align in contiguous walls of a structure for penetration by the threaded bolt-type members. Optionally washers are placed between nuts, bolt heads and co-operating convex and concave surfaces and spacers. The bolts may be fitted with corresponding threaded nuts. These may be tightened to clamp the washers, spacers, and contiguous walls of adjacent modules together.

The modular construction is ideally adapted to accommodate movement by way of at least two washers, spacers or other means, which in use are placed adjacent one another, whereby the overall construction is convex in one plane. Optionally an oversized aperture may be provided in the plates so that movement of the bolt is permitted therewithin. Alternatively there may be an undersized bolt and this too permits an additional degree of freedom of movement. The bolt type member is preferably a hollow threaded tube. In an enhanced embodiment a wedge is also co-located with the fixing.

It will be appreciated that by providing holes or apertures in the walls of the elements the passage of fluid, liquid, paste, hardenable filler or any other liquid material is permitted. Any such fluid material may be used as reinforcement, as a thermal or acoustic insulation medium, as a heat transfer medium or for any other purpose.

Where a liquid or semi-solid medium is introduced into contact with a part or fully assembled structure, a vibration device may be arranged to vibrate or jiggle a structure so that energy is transmitted therethrough thereby promoting the passage of the liquid medium through the holes. An advantage is that a pre-stressed concrete structure can be readily fabricated using a lattice or framework of the construction elements and the vibration of the liquid can be used to promote even distribution of the concrete and reduce the risk of voids occurring within the structure.
In this embodiment the invention may be incorporated as a casting to form floors, levels, steps, walkways or similar such structures.

Ideally elements are formed from a single strip by way of bending or flexing along one or more lines of weakness. Alternatively the two flat portions may be hinged, so that modules may be stored or transported flat and assembled in situ. The base of the prism may be triangular, square, rectangular, hexagonal or any closed polygon.

For the purposes of this description the term prism is intended to encompass both an object whose sides or faces are tapered or diminish in size, as well as one whose sides remain uniform and parallel. Thus, in the former sense the term prism includes a 'frustum' (or truncated pyramid); and in the latter the term prism applies to a solid of uniform cross sectional body. It is understood that the base of the frustum can be any appropriate closed polygon.

Means may be provided to permit the two flat portions to be angled and interconnected so as to build a structure from a plurality of modules, for example so as to enable the construction of larger items such as walls, floors, roofs, struts, beams and other such items.

Advantageously bracing and structural units are one and the same unit and comprise a bent sheet material of a generally V-shaped cross-section, ideally the included angle of which is approximately 60°, thereby permitting, in use, the formation of equilateral triangular networks, meshes, structures, shapes or forms.
The invention will now be described by way of examples and with reference to the following Figures in which:

heading.u: Detailed Description of Preferred Embodiments of the Invention

description.p: Referring to the Figures, Figure 1a shows a diagrammatical plan view of construction module 100 of a generally hexagonal form having no peripheral bracing. Module 100 comprises six identical steel plates 50a, 50b, 50c, 50d, 50e and 50f bent into chevron form units or components in chevron form. Outer modules 50b, 50c and 50e act as peripheral brace member for 50a, 50d and 50f. Because effectively joint components are the same as bracing components, this reduces the number of types of components required.

Figure 1b is an overall, diagrammatical view of six modules interconnected by way of three rigid or hollow rods 603. Holes or apertures are disposed throughout the assembled structure. An enhanced embodiment of the invention may also include cylindrical steel tubes as well as pipe and nut fixtures (not shown) as described above.

Figures 2a and 2b show further embodiments of the invention wherein a hexagonal modular structural element is formed from components 50 with holes or apertures 54 and 55 formed therein. The structure is made up from 6 equilateral triangular forms. As can be seen from Figure 2b the triangular sub-modules and hexagonal module formed therefrom are defined either by interlocking V-shaped plates or equilateral triangular shaped forms. These plates or forms generally have an angle of 60° so as to define an equilateral triangle.

Figure 2c is an overall diagrammatic view of a domed structure 80 formed from a plurality of modules of hexagonal form, for example of the type shown in Figure 4, but interconnected with angled joints. Adjacent modules are connected, for example by use of variable angle compressive side connecting joint, of the type shown in Figure 3b. This imparts an overall curvature to the assemblage. An advantage of the modular structure is that it is capable of flexing and adopting a shape that conforms to an applied force.

Plates 50 may be formed for example by cutting or punching a thin sheet of metal (not shown), such as sheet steel. The ideal shape of the element is either a: V-shaped form (produced by folding a strip so that two ends subtend an angle of 60°) or an equilateral triangle (produced by folding a strip twice to form a closed loop, so that three angles of 60° are subtended). Apertures or holes 54, 55 (shown in Figure 4) may be pre-formed into the metal sheet (prior to elements being cut) or cut or punched after elements 50 have been cut or formed. Elements 50 are then bent along a fold or suitable line of weakness. At any stage of the process a line of weakness, such as a crease, fold or a scoring line may be formed on the metal sheet.

Referring to Figures 2a and 2b, in which structural walls 50 and bracings 50 are of similar form. This is termed 'integral' bracing. The advantage is that only one type of constructional element is needed. This saves time and money. An hexagonal module, of the type shown in Figure 4 can be formed using as few as four such elements.

It is to be understood that bent sheet material for the components does not have to be bent during their manufacture. Components may be moulded or formed as such. Thus the term 'bent' should be construed to include any such element having sheet like portions, which are at an angle to each other and have a common edge. They may even be hinged, sold and transported in this form. It is advantageous to build structures from modules and UK Patent Application GB-A-2 335 211 describes example of hexagonal construction modules.

The invention described herein may be used as piling and when arranged in hexagonal, cellular form is suitable as part of sea or coastal defence barrier. Alternatively, when assembled as hereinafter described, modules may be used to form an internal strengthening framework for a walkway, building or other construction.

Referring now briefly to Figure 3a, there is shown a module with two side walls 402 and 403 such as sheet metal (or walls 50) of connected and compressed together in contiguous alignment by means of an externally threaded pipe 404 and two locking means, which are nuts 405A, 405B. Also included are co-operating dished and hemispherical washers 406A and 406B respectively. Such curved washers allow fixture of the side elements at different angles without causing uneven pressure concentrations. The threaded pipe and nut fixtures can be set a variable torque pressures also; this allows greater control of the rigidity of the structure during construction.

Figure 3b shows an enhanced embodiment of the invention; it is identical to the embodiment shown in Figure 3a except that it includes a wedge 407 or tapered spacer 407 (at a first taper angle θ) between the sidewalls 402 and 403, again allowing fixtures to be arranged with respect one to another at a chosen angle. In particular the wedge 407 includes a hole, which allows it to be co-located with a connecting joint, thereby ensuring it is fixed in the correct location.

In Figure 3b, when nut 405A is tightened (in a contra-torque sense with respect to nut 405B) and abuts flush with respect to slanted side of the joint, nuts 405A and 405B align so that their faces are contiguous with the sheets 402 and 406B respectively as a result contra-torque .

It will be understood that there are various alternative designs, which fall within the scope of the invention as defined by the appended claims that would be known to the skilled person. A nut and bolt arrangement may replace two nub balls and hollow tube arrangement. Also it is to be appreciated that the bolt type member may have a middle section devoid of threading to allow spacing.
Figure 3c is an overall diagrammatic view of an open structure 99, suitable for assembling in to a modular array and having walls 50 which have a slight tapering 52.

Figure 3d is a plan view of a blank 309 which when folded along lines 310, forms a wedge that is suitable for use against a surface, as a wedge or prism. In use a bolt or connector passes through aperture 311.

Figure 4 is an overall, diagrammatical view of seven assembled modules 60, 61, 62, 63, 64, 65 and 66 positioned adjacent one another and capable of being interconnected. In the example shown three rods 58, 58a and 58b interconnect the seven modules, for example through holes or apertures aligned throughout the assembled structure. Connectors 58, 58a and 58b may be of the type described with reference to Figures 3a and 3b. The term 'module' is intended to describe a complete hexagonal form and the term assemblage is intended to encompass more than two or more such modules when connected.

As mentioned above, with reference to Figure 2c, when modules are connected using the connectors of Figures 3a and 3b, along adjacent plates (50a, 50b, 50c, 50d, 50e and 50f in Figure 1), a curved form is imparted to the overall assemblage.

Although the invention has been described by way of preferred embodiments, it will be appreciated that variation may be made to the embodiments, without departing from the scope of the invention as defined by the appended claims. For example, it will be appreciated that another application of the invention is for use as an architectural or any other modelling technique where a readily deployable system can be used to build a scale model quickly and cheaply.

Although reference has been made to the use of steel as a construction medium it will be appreciated that other materials or composites may be used in the sheets and/or connectors including: synthetic plastics, carbon fibres, alloys, glass reinforced plastics, aluminium, polymers or any combination of the aforesaid materials.

claim.claim-text: Modulares Konstruktionssystem, das Folgendes umfasst: mehrere Bauelemente (50) mit einem V-förmigen oder winkelförmigen Querschnitt, die dazu eingerichtet sind, in einer zellförmigen Konfiguration zusammengefügt zu werden, und ein Verbindungsteil (404), wobei besagte Bauelemente (50) Öffnungen (604) aufweisen, die darin ausgebildet sind und dazu eingerichtet sind, das Verbindungsteil (404) aufzunehmen, wobei besagtes Verbindungsteil (404) ein Maß an relativer Bewegung zwischen besagten Bauelementen (50) in zwei Rotationsfreiheitsgraden ermöglicht, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass besagte Bewegung von einem Paar benachbarter Unterlegscheiben bereitgestellt wird, wobei eine Unterlegscheibe (406A) eine im Wesentlichen konkave Oberfläche hat und die andere Unterlegscheibe (406B) eine im Wesentlichen konvexe Oberfläche hat.
Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach Anspruch 1, wobei eine Unterlegscheibe (406B) halbkugelförmig ist und die andere (406A) schalenförmig ist.

Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach entweder Anspruch 1 oder 2, wobei das Verbindungsteil (404) ein Gewindestangenelement (404) aufweist, das im Gebrauch durch die Öffnungen (604) in besagten Bauelementen (50) hindurchtritt und auf das besagte Unterlegscheiben (406A, 406B) geschraubt sind.

Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach Anspruch 3, das einen Keil (407) aufweist, der zwischen besagten Bauelementen (50) angeordnet ist und ortsgleich mit besagtem und durch besagtes Stangenelement (404) angeordnet ist.
Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach Anspruch 3, wobei das Gewindestangenelement (404) ein hohles Gewinderohr ist.
Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach einem beliebigen der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei besagte Bauelemente (50a, 50b, 50c, 50d, 50e, 50f) im Wesentlichen identisch sind.
Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach Anspruch 1, wobei der V-förmige Querschnitt der Bauelemente (50) einen Winkel von ungefähr 60 ° überstreicht.

Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach einem beliebigen der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Bewegung mittels einer Basis eines Kegelstumpfs begrenzt wird, wobei besagter Kegelstumpf aus der Gruppe von Formen stammt, die Folgendes umfasst: Dreieck, Quadrat, Rechteck oder Sechseck.

Modulares Konstruktionssystem nach einem beliebigen der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei verbundene Bauelemente (50) eine dreidimensionale gewölbte Fläche definieren, die ein Prisma mit konisch zulaufenden Seiten umfasst.

Verfahren zum Verbinden eines Bauelements (50) mit einem anderen unter Verwendung des Verbindungsteils (404) nach Anspruch 1, des Paars benachbarter Unterlegscheiben (406A, 406B) nach Anspruch 1 und der Bauelemente (50), die dazu eingerichtet sind, in einer zellförmigen Konfiguration nach Anspruch 1 zusammengefügt zu werden, um ein Modul (100) zu definieren.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, wobei eine Unterlegscheibe (406B) halbkugelförmig ist und die andere (406A) schalenförmig ist.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 10 oder 11, das den folgenden Schritt umfasst: Einsetzen eines Stangenelements (404) in die Öffnungen (604) in besagten Bauelementen (50) und Schrauben besagter Unterlegscheiben (406A, 406B) auf besagtes Stangenelement.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 12, wobei das Stangenelement (404) ein hohles Gewinderohr ist.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 13, das weiterhin die Verwendung eines Stangenelements (404), von Unterlegscheiben (406A, 406B) und zwei Muttern (405A, 405B) beinhaltet, um Komponenten zusammenzufügen.
Bauwerk, das mehrere Module (100) nach einem beliebigen der Ansprüche 10 bis 14 umfasst und eine härtbare Füllmasse, wie Beton, beinhaltet.

Verfahren zur Verstärkung des Bauwerks nach Definition in Anspruch 15, wobei Löcher in den Bauelementen (50) bereitgestellt werden, um den Durchgang der härtbaren Füllmasse zu gestatten, indem die härtbare Füllmasse eingebracht und mit dem Bauwerk in Kontakt gebracht und das Bauwerk gerüttelt wird, um den Durchgang der härtbaren Füllmasse durch die Löcher und die gleichmäßige Verteilung der härtbaren Füllmasse zu fördern.

A modular construction system comprising: a plurality of structural elements (50) of V-shaped or chevron-shaped cross section adapted to be assembled in a cellular configuration, and a connector (404), said structural elements (50) having apertures (604) formed therein and being adapted to receive the connector (404), said connector (404) allows an amount of relative movement between said structural elements (50) in two rotational degrees of freedom, characterised in that said movement is provided by a pair of adjacent washers, one washer (406A) having a substantially concave surface and the other washer (406B) having a substantially convex surface.
A modular construction system as claimed in claim 1 wherein one washer (406B) is hemispherical and the other (406A) is dish shaped.

A modular construction system as claimed in either claim 1 or 2 wherein the connector (404) includes a threaded bolt-type member (404), which in use passes through the apertures (604) in said structural elements (50), and onto which is threaded said washers (406A, 406B).
A modular construction system as claimed in claim 3, including a wedge (407) located between said structural elements (50) and co-located with and by said bolt-type member (404).
A modular construction system as claimed in claim 3 wherein the threaded bolt type member (404) is a hollow threaded tube.
A modular construction system according to any preceding claim wherein said structural elements (50a, 50b, 50c, 50d, 50e, 50f) are substantially identical.
A modular construction system according to claim 1 wherein the V-shaped cross-section of structural elements (50) subtends an angle of approximately 60°.

A modular construction system according to any preceding claim wherein movement is limited by way of a base of a frustum, said frustum being from the group of shapes comprising: triangle, square, rectangle or hexagon.
A modular construction system according to any preceding claim wherein connected structural elements (50) define a three-dimensionally curved surface comprising a prism having tapered sides.

A method of connecting one structural element (50) to another using the connector (404) according to claim 1, a pair of adjacent washers (406A, 406B) according to claim 1, and structural elements (50) adapted to be assembled in a cellular configuration according to claim 1 to define a module (100).
A method as claimed in claim 10 wherein one washer (406B) is hemispherical and the other (406A) dish shaped.

A method as claimed in claims 10 or 11 comprising the step of: inserting a bolt type member (404) into the apertures (604) in said structural elements (50) and threading said washers (406A, 406B) onto said bolt type member.
A method as claimed in claim 12 wherein the bolt type member (404) is a hollow threaded tube.
A method as claimed in claim 13 further including use of a bolt-type member (404), washers (406A, 406B) and two nuts (405A, 405B) in order to secure together components.
A building construction comprising a plurality of modules (100) as claimed in any of claims 10 to 14 and including a hardenable filler, such as concrete.

A method of reinforcing the building construction defined in claim 15 wherein holes are provided in the structural elements (50) to permit passage of the hardenable filler, by introducing the hardenable filler into contact with the building construction, and vibrating the building construction to promote the passage through the holes and even distribution of the hardenable filler.

Système de construction modulaire comportant : une pluralité d'éléments de structure (50) à coupe transversale en forme de V ou en forme de chevron adaptés à des fins d'assemblage en une configuration cellulaire, et un connecteur (404), lesdits éléments de structure (50) ayant des ouvertures (604) formées dans ceux-ci et étant adaptés à des fins de réception du connecteur (404), ledit connecteur (404) permettant une quantité de mouvement relatif entre lesdits éléments de structure (50) dans deux degrés de liberté de rotation, caractérisé en ce que ledit mouvement est mis en oeuvre par une paire de rondelles adjacentes, une rondelle (406A) ayant une surface sensiblement concave et l'autre rondelle (406B) ayant une surface sensiblement convexe.
Système de construction modulaire selon la revendication 1, dans lequel une rondelle (406B) est hémisphérique et l'autre (406A) est en forme de cuvette.

Système de construction modulaire selon la revendication 1 ou la revendication 2, dans lequel le connecteur (404) comprend un élément de type boulon fileté (404), qui lors de l'utilisation traverse les ouvertures (604) dans lesdits éléments de structure (50), et sur lequel sont vissées lesdites rondelles (406A, 406B).
Système de construction modulaire selon la revendication 3, comprenant une cale (407) située entre lesdits éléments de structure (50) et co-située avec et par ledit élément de type boulon (404).
Système de construction modulaire selon la revendication 3, dans lequel l'élément de type boulon fileté (404) est un tube fileté creux.
Système de construction modulaire selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel lesdits éléments de structure (50a, 50b, 50c, 50d, 50e, 50f) sont sensiblement identiques.
Système de construction modulaire selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la coupe transversale en forme de V des éléments de structure (50) sous-tend un angle d'approximativement 60°.

Système de construction modulaire selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel le mouvement est limité au moyen d'une base d'un tronc de cône, ledit tronc de cône provenant du groupe de formes comportant : un triangle, un carré, un rectangle ou un hexagone.

Système de construction modulaire selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel des éléments de structure connectés (50) définissent une surface courbe tridimensionnelle, comportant un prisme ayant des côtés à section dégressive.

Procédé permettant de connecter un élément de structure (50) à un autre en utilisant le connecteur (404) selon la revendication 1, une paire de rondelles adjacentes (406A, 406B) selon la revendication 1, et des éléments de structure (50) adaptés à des fins d'assemblage en une configuration cellulaire selon la revendication 1 afin de définir un module (100).
Procédé selon la revendication 10, dans lequel une rondelle (406B) est hémisphérique et l'autre (406A) est en forme de cuvette.

Procédé selon la revendication 10 ou la revendication 11, comportant l'étape consistant à : insérer un élément de type boulon (404) dans les ouvertures (604) dans lesdits éléments de structure (50) et visser lesdites rondelles (406A, 406B) sur ledit élément de type boulon.
Procédé selon la revendication 12, dans lequel l'élément de type boulon (404) est un tube fileté creux.

Procédé selon la revendication 13, comprenant par ailleurs l'utilisation d'un élément de type boulon (404), de rondelles (406A, 406B) et de deux écrous (405A, 405B) afin d'assujettir les composants ensemble.
Bâtiment ou construction comportant une pluralité de modules (100) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 10 à 14 et comprenant une charge en mesure de durcir, tel du béton.

Procédé de renfort de la construction de bâtiment définie selon la revendication 15, dans lequel des trous sont mis en oeuvre dans les éléments de structure (50) afin de permettre de passage de la charge en mesure de durcir, par l'introduction de la charge en mesure de durcir en contact avec la construction de bâtiment, et par la vibration de la construction de bâtiment en vue de promouvoir le passage au travers des trous et une distribution uniforme de la charge en mesure de durcir.
